page.title: 01The Tywyn Hills in Gwynedd
page.content: Most of the region is covered by grass, heath and moorland - the valley floors of the rivers Aysynni and Fathew containing enclosed grazing land while further up, the hillland exhibit scrub and moorland. Numerous v shaped river valley. Dot the area, flowing into the Afon Fathew. As expected much of the land is used for cattle and sheep-raising, but there is also a local railway which follows the valley floor towards the coactal down of Tywyn. Patches of deciduous trees occasionally cover the lowland plains and lower parts of Tywyn Hills.
